wikipedia_page.main: Harry Frank Ernest Bamford MBE (8 April 1914 – 4 June 1949) was an English professional footballer who played in the Football League for Brighton & Hove Albion as a left back or outside left.

response: After a club record 5th-place finish in Brentford's debut season in the top flight, manager Harry Curtis kept faith with the season's previous squad, releasing outside forward Jim Brown and bringing in youngsters Harry Bamford and Joe Murray. Teenage outside right Les Smith, who had signed his first professional contract a year earlier, was promoted to the first team squad after Bobby Reid was struck down by appendicitis on the eve of the season.
Harry Bamford (1920–1958) was an English footballer for Bristol Rovers.
Harry Bamford may also refer to:
*Harry Bamford (footballer, born 1914) (1914–1949), English footballer for Brentford FC and Brighton & Hove Albion
*Harry Bamford (footballer, born 1886) (1886–1915), English footballer for Southampton FC
